Hi,
	I am developing a SLEAT TicTacToe screen saver, to use the space 
cycles of the various machines I have available.

	I was wondering whether anybody else would be interested in running it for me?

	It's not as fully automatic as Seti@Home, in that you will need to 
mail the results back to me (which will typically zip down to about 1/2 a meg).

	It will probably be ready about Wednesday, so far I have the 
background evolving working, but I don't have any graphics on the 
screen to prove it is working...

	Oh yes, it's Windows... if anybody wanted to run it on Linux then I 
could probably knock up a stand-alone exe, but I don't know anything 
about Linux screen savers.

	Ian
In 15 minutes everybody will be in the future.
